instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message:
I found a broken <CAPACITOR>C7584</CAPACITOR> and replaced it. 
Now <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 4v

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>:
1- 0v
2 - 19,5v
3 - 5.2v
9 - 0,5v
12 - 3,4v
13 - 3,4v
15 - 0,06v
17 - 8.6v
19 - 5v
20 - 5v
27 - 19.5v

L3095 - 0v 
L7130 -  8.5v
L7520 - 0v
L7560 - 0.7v 
L7430 - 0v
L7630 - 0v
L7310/20 - 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message:
" Now <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 4v
............................
17 - 8.6v"
How is this possible???
Please, post accurate information.

Check <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> basic voltages; 23, 22, 12, 13, 29, 21.
Be sure no short, or low resistance on any big coil.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message:
I checked three times.  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on F7140 - 4v and 17 - 8.6v

<CHIP>U7501</CHIP>:
23 - 4v
22 - 3.3v
12 - 3.4v
13  - 2v
29 - 4v
21 - 3.4v

L7310/20 - 10.3 ohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message:
Which pin of F7140 did you check?

Check <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR>/51/52.

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message:
"Pin 1 - 8.5v, pin 2 - 4v"
And you still keep that fuse on the board?
How good it is, did you think about that?

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message: Fuses looked fine was not broken - continuity of the circuit . I replaced it and of course it works. How do you check if such a fuse is defective ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message:
Continuity mode, no?

Machine works now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message: The fuse was not blown. After replacing it, the machine works

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message:
How can you explain different voltage on the pins of "not blown" fuse???
Continuity mode not always shows bad fuse.
I faced with this problem, after found shorted cap into CPU power supply.
Fuse showed good in diode mode, but machine spins fan 1-2s, or turned off after 10s; fixed replacing the fuse.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message: Helpful lesson. Thank you for your help
